Job Posting:175382 - Position: W26 Risk Specialist Intern 175382B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 11/19/2025 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 11/14/2025 01:45 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Interac Corp. Suite 2400 - 200 Bay Street Toronto M5J 2J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description REQ-2003 2026 - Winter W26 Risk Specialist Intern 175382B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Risk Specialist Intern - Data & Design Focus At Interac, we design and deliver products and solutions that give Canadians control over their money so they can get more out of life. But that's not all. Whether we're leading real-time money movement, driving innovative commerce solutions like open payments for transit systems, or making advancements in new areas like verification and open banking, we are playing a key role in shaping the future of the digital economy in Canada. Want to make a lasting impact amongst a community of creative thinkers, problem solvers, technical gurus and high-performance application developers? We want to hear from you. This is not your typical risk management internship. We are looking for a data-savvy, design-minded intern to help us reimagine how risk is communicated and operationalized across the business. You'll work at the intersection of engineering, analytics, and business design, helping us build the next generation of risk dashboards, reporting systems, and workflow tools. You'll collaborate directly with senior leaders and cross-functional teams to bring clarity, structure, and insight to complex risk data, turning it into something people actually want to use You'll be responsible for: • Design and build dashboards that bring risk data to life-enabling smarter, faster decisions across the organization. • Prototype and iterate on reporting templates and visualizations using tools like Power BI or Tableau. • Map and streamline workflows to clarify ownership and show how risk moves through the business. • Document and improve processes that support accountability, transparency, and operational resilience. • Collaborate across teams, including business lines, corporate functions, product, technology, data, and compliance to understand risk reporting needs and elevate them into integrated, scalable systems. • Support the evolution of enterprise risk reporting tools, helping to modernize how risk is visualized, communicated, and embedded across the organization. Workstyle: Hybrid (3 days on-site) Location: Toronto Term: January to April 2026 Duration: Monday - Friday Interac requires employees to complete a background check that is completed by one of our service providers. We use this service to complete the following checks: • Canadian criminal record check; • Public safety verification; • Canadian ID cross-check; • 5-year employment verification; • Education verification; and • If applicable, Credit Inquiry and Social Media Check How we work We know that exceptional people have great ideas and are passionate about their work. Our culture encourages excellence and actively rewards contributions with: Connection: You're surrounded by talented people every day who are driven by their passion of a common goal. Core Values: They define us. Living them helps us be the best at what we do. Compensation & Benefits: Pay is driven by individual and corporate performance and we provide a multitude of benefits and perks. Education: To ensure you are the best at what you do we invest in you Please be aware of certain individuals fraudulently using Interac Corp.'s name and logo to offer fictitious employment opportunities. Interac Corp. will never ask, solicit, nor accept any monies in exchange for employment opportunities. Any such offers of employment are fraudulent and invalid, and you are strongly advised to exercise great caution and disregard such offers and invitations. Please note that under no circumstances shall Interac Corp. be held liable or responsible for any claims, losses, damages, expenses, or other inconveniences resulting from or in any way connected to the actions of individuals performing such fraud. Further, such fraudulent communication shall not be treated as any kind of offer or representation by Interac Corp. or its subsidiaries and affiliates. Job Requirements You bring: • Your currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business, or a related field at a recognized Canadian institution. • You have a strong analytical mindset and can translate complex data into clear, actionable insights. • You're fluent in Microsoft 365 (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook) and comfortable navigating shared platforms like SharePoint and Teams. • You have hands-on experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms. • You bring attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and a willingness to work through ambiguity. • You're comfortable working independently and collaboratively, managing multiple priorities with confidence and focus. • You're curious about how organizations manage risk and how data, design, and systems thinking can make it better. • You're confident engaging with stakeholders and understanding how their work connects to broader business processes. • You're disciplined, organized, and thrive in environments where deadlines and quality both matter • You bring attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and a willingness to work through ambiguity • You're disciplined, organized, and thrive in environments where deadlines and quality both matter. • You build trust easily and enjoy working with people across different teams and levels Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following: • An engineering background or experience with risk, compliance, or process design is a plus-but not essential. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Application Link: Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
